intro: Delarbrea balansae, commonly known as the Balansae delarbrea, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
